com.firebase.jobdispatcher

Class Trigger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.firebase.jobdispatcher.Trigger

  • public final class Trigger
extends java.lang.Object
    Generally, a Trigger is an object that can answer the question, "is this job ready to run?"

    More specifically, a Trigger is an opaque, abstract class used to root the type hierarchy.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static JobTrigger.ImmediateTrigger NOW
      Immediate is a Trigger that's immediately available.

    • Field Detail

      • NOW

        public static final JobTrigger.ImmediateTrigger NOW
        Immediate is a Trigger that's immediately available. The Job will be run as soon as the runtime constraints are satisfied.

        It is invalid to schedule an Immediate with a recurring Job.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Trigger

        public Trigger()

    • Method Detail

      • executionWindow

        public static JobTrigger.ExecutionWindowTrigger executionWindow(int windowStart,
                                                                int windowEnd)
        Creates a new ExecutionWindow based on the provided time interval.
        Parameters:
        windowStart - The earliest time (in seconds) the job should be considered eligible to run. Calculated from when the job was scheduled (for new jobs) or last run (for recurring jobs).
        windowEnd - The latest time (in seconds) the job should be run in an ideal world. Calculated in the same way as windowStart.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the provided parameters are too restrictive.

      • contentUriTrigger

        public static JobTrigger.ContentUriTrigger contentUriTrigger(java.util.List<ObservedUri> uris)
        Creates a new ContentUriTrigger based on the provided list of ObservedUri.
        Parameters:
        uris - The list of URIs to observe. The trigger will be available if a piece of content, corresponding to any of provided URIs, is updated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if provided list of URIs is null or empty.
